message.content: This question requires some basic understanding of flower anatomy and pollination. As the size of a flower increases, it is able to produce more nectar, which in turn attracts more pollinators. Monarchs, which are butterflies known for their long-distance migrations, are attracted to flowers with abundant nectar. Option (B) is incorrect because grass is not a pollinator. Option (C) is incorrect because carnivores do not typically pollinate flowers. Option (D) is incorrect because toy butterflies are not real pollinators.
